definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: Story of cultural symbols of China's mentorship.
sentences.chinese: 故事的文化符号就是中国的师徒关系。

sentences.english: Relationship itself is, in every moment, always already the case.
sentences.chinese: 师徒关系本身，在每一个当下一直就是如此。

sentences.english: Mendoza was quick to learn. Very soon the two men quarreled bitterly.
sentences.chinese: 门多萨进步很快，师徒俩很快发生矛盾。

sentences.english: In the suburb of Liang, they meet each other by chance.
sentences.chinese: 师徒俩在梁地的郊外碰巧遇上了。

sentences.english: Relationship itself always already exists as your living condition.
sentences.chinese: 师徒关系本身一直是你当下的境况。

sentences.english: A master-prentice system was created here and spread into inland China.
sentences.chinese: 二龟兹开始创立了师徒传承的体制，并影响到内地。

sentences.english: A successful mentoring relationship needs equal parts utility and emotion.
sentences.chinese: 成功的师徒关系需要效果与热情。

sentences.english: Apprenticeships were a common means of educating new physicians in the Western Han Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 师徒相授制度是东汉常见的培训医师方法。

sentences.english: This is also true with teachers and disciples.
He is indenture to a builder.
sentences.chinese: 他与一建筑工人订了师徒合同。

sentences.english: This is also true with teachersdisciples.
For 12 years, Qui -Gon and Xanatos are master and apprentice.
sentences.chinese: 魁刚和萨那托斯当了12年的师徒。

definition: used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
to formally become an apprentice to a master
young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate
senior male fellow student or apprentice/son (older than oneself) of one's teacher
term of respect for your teacher's wife
